questions.question_text:
A company has a custom object, Sales_Help_Request__c, that has a Lookup relationship to Opportunity. The Sales_Help_Request__c has a number field, Number_of_Hours__c, that represents the amount of time spent on the Sales_Help_Request__c.

A developer is tasked with creating a field, Total_Hours__c, on Opportunity that should be the sum of all of the Number_of_Hours__c values for the Sales_Help_Request__c records related to that Opportunity.

What should the developer use to implement this?

choices.B: A trigger on the Opportunity object
choices.D: A roll-up summary field on the Sales_Help_Request__c object
choices.C: A record-triggered flow on the Sales_Help_Request__c object
choices.A: A roll-up summary field on the Opportunity object

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Why B? You won't be able to trigger this from opportunity as the opportunity itself won't be aware that a new Sales_Help_Request__c has been linked to itself nor that there is an update on the Number_of_Hours__c fields on the Sales_Help_Request__c. According to me, it should be C...
